title: Workflow Descriptor
description: Machine-readable schema for stateful work-item workflows. Defines valid state transitions, commands, invariants, and roles for the AMPA engine and human collaborators. See workflow-language.md for the specification.

version.description: Semantic version of the workflow spec (e.g., '1.0.0').

status.description: Ordered list of allowed coarse lifecycle statuses (e.g., open, in_progress, blocked, closed).

stage.description: Ordered list of allowed finer-grained phases (e.g., idea, intake_complete, plan_complete, in_progress, in_review, done).

states.description: Map of friendly alias names to {status, stage} tuples. Aliases can be used in command from/to fields.

terminal_states.description: List of state aliases (or inline tuples) that are terminal â€” dead-end states that require no outbound transitions. Used by validation to suppress dead-end warnings.

invariants.description: List of named invariant definitions that commands reference in pre/post fields.

commands.description: Map of command definitions keyed by command name. Command names should be imperative verbs (e.g., intake, plan, delegate).

description.description: Human-readable description of the workflow's purpose.

owner.description: Team or individual responsible for maintaining this workflow definition.

links.description: Optional map of related links (e.g., documentation, source repos).

roles.description: List of role definitions used by commands. The executor maps roles to concrete humans or agents.

description.description: Human-readable description of the role's responsibilities.

type.description: Whether this role is typically filled by a human, an AI agent, or either.

status.description: Must reference a value declared in the top-level status array.

stage.description: Must reference a value declared in the top-level stage array.

StateRef.description: A reference to a state: either a string alias (referencing the states map) or an inline {status, stage} tuple.

oneOf.description: Alias name defined in the top-level states map.

name.description: Unique identifier for this invariant, referenced by command pre/post lists.

description.description: Human-readable description of what this invariant checks.

when.description: When this invariant is evaluated: 'pre' (before command), 'post' (after command), 'both', or an array ['pre', 'post'].

logic.description: Machine-checkable rule expression. Keep declarative. Exact expression language is implementation-specific but must be documented alongside the workflow.

type.description: Data type of the input field.

required.description: Whether this input is required for the command to execute.

default.description: Optional default value if the input is not provided.

add_tags.description: Tags to add to the work item after the command succeeds.

remove_tags.description: Tags to remove from the work item after the command succeeds.

set_assignee.description: Assign the work item to this role or agent after the command succeeds.

set_needs_producer_review.description: Set the needs-producer-review flag on the work item.

notifications.description: Notifications to emit after the command succeeds.

audit.description: Audit details to record for AI-driven commands.

Effects.description: Optional side effects to assert/emit after successful command execution.

description.description: Short human-readable summary of what the command does.

from.description: List of allowed source state tuples. Each entry is a state alias or an inline {status, stage} tuple.

to.description: Target state tuple applied when the command succeeds. Must be a single alias or {status, stage} tuple.

actor.description: Role that executes this command. Must reference a role declared in metadata.roles.

pre.description: List of invariant names that must pass before the command may run.

post.description: List of invariant names that must pass after the transition is applied.

inputs.description: Schema-like object describing required/optional arguments for this command.

prompt_ref.description: Optional path to a versioned prompt template (e.g., 'prompts/delegate.md'). Template variables must correspond to inputs.

effects.description: Optional additional side effects (tags, notifications, audit records).

dispatch_map.description: Maps each from-state alias to a shell command template. Templates may use {id} for work item ID substitution.
